newsitem.title: UK: Granada drops as report kills demerger hopes.
newsitem.headline: Granada drops as report kills demerger hopes.

text.p: Shares in Granada Group Plc dropped on Friday after a press report doused lingering speculation that the company, whose interests range from hotels to television, could demerge its media operations, analysts and dealers said.
The stock was down 13-1/2p at 900 by 1058 GMT in volume of 2.8 million shares.
"It had been in the price for some time that they would probably have a demerger...and that it would be broadly beneficial to the group," said Jason Crisp, analyst at SocGen.
A report in the Financial Times said Granada had ruled out a split for the foreseeable future, following a detailed review of the company's structure.
The FT said Granada would instead focus on building up its television operations and redoubling efforts to expand internationally.
No-one at Granada was immediately available for comment.
